item.title: 【Albums (lossy)】iTunes Plus - Sophie Ellis-Bextor - Discography
item.description:
Happy new year lovely humans,

I have noticed that a lot of people are becoming interested in Sophie's music after her iconic song "Murder on the Dancefloor" being feature in the movie Saltburn. So happy that she is getting more recognition. So, I decided to share with you her discography:




Albums:
​
1- Read My Lips (UK reissue) - 2001
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.

2- Shoot from the Hip - 2003
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
3- Trip the Light Fantastic + Bonus Tracks - 2007 (Her best album, I believe she peaked with this one).
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
4- Make a Scene + Bonus Tracks - 2011 (Fun fact, this album was meant to be a Greatest Hits but then because the new material she recorded was great she decided to do a new album).
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
5- Wanderlust - 2014 (This album was a departure from her disco/pop sound, and she went to more indie pop and folk, still a great album).
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
6- Familia - 2016 (This was sort of a continuation of Wanderlust, again very indie pop and folk sounds. This is my least favorite album by her).
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
7- Hana (Deluxe Version) - 2023 (Her latest entry, a great album going back to her disco/pop roots)
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.

Compilations:
​
1- The Song Diaries - 2019 (This one has orchestra versions of her previous songs)
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
2- Songs from the Kitchen Disco - 2020
Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
There is also a live album called Kitchen Disco – Live at the London Palladium, it is not worth checking and I don't have it as well.

Enjoyyyyxx
Qadeera
item.author: qadeera.official
